content:
To add Samba and share the watched folder in OctoPrint to your local network, you can follow these steps:

1. Install Samba on your OctoPrint machine by running the following command:
```
sudo apt-get install samba samba-common-bin
```
1. Create a new Samba configuration file by running the following command:
```
sudo nano /etc/samba/smb.conf
```
1. Add the following lines to the configuration file, replacing "/path/to/watched/folder" with the actual path to the watched folder on your OctoPrint machine:
```
[OctoPrint]
  comment = OctoPrint Watched Folder
  path = /path/to/watched/folder
  browseable = yes
  read only = no
  guest ok = no
  create mask = 0644
  directory mask = 0755
  force user = pi
```
1. Save and close the configuration file.
2. Restart the Samba service by running the following command:
```
sudo service smbd restart
```
1. Add a Samba user for the Snapmaker user by running the following command:
```
sudo smbpasswd -a Snapmaker
```
1. Follow the prompts to set a password for the Snapmaker user.
2. You should now be able to access the watched folder from other devices on your local network by browsing to "\[OctoPrint IP address]\OctoPrint" in the file explorer. The Snapmaker user will be able to authenticate with the password you set.

I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any questions or if you need further assistance.
